name: Typography
description: The art and technique of arranging type to make written language legible, readable, and visually appealing. Includes font selection, sizing, spacing, and hierarchy.

name: Color Theory
description: Understanding color relationships, contrast, harmony, and psychological effects. Applying color strategically to create mood, hierarchy, and brand consistency.

name: Visual Hierarchy
description: Organizing elements to guide user attention and create clear information flow. Using size, color, contrast, and spacing to communicate importance.

name: Layout & Composition
description: Arranging visual elements on a page or screen using grids, alignment, and whitespace to create balanced, functional designs.

name: Iconography
description: Creating and selecting icons that clearly communicate meaning. Understanding icon systems, consistency, and contextual appropriateness.

name: User Research
description: Gathering insights about user needs, behaviors, and pain points through interviews, surveys, observation, and data analysis.

name: Information Architecture
description: Organizing and structuring content to help users find information and complete tasks efficiently. Creating navigation systems and content hierarchies.

name: Interaction Design
description: Designing how users interact with interfaces through clicks, taps, gestures, and other inputs. Creating intuitive, responsive experiences.

name: Usability
description: Ensuring products are easy to learn, efficient to use, and satisfying. Identifying and eliminating friction points in user flows.

name: Accessibility
description: Designing for users with diverse abilities including visual, auditory, motor, and cognitive disabilities. Following WCAG guidelines.

name: Component Design
description: Creating reusable UI components that are flexible, consistent, and maintainable. Understanding component states, variants, and edge cases.

name: Design Systems
description: Building and maintaining collections of reusable components, patterns, and guidelines that ensure consistency across products.

name: Responsive Design
description: Creating layouts that adapt gracefully to different screen sizes and devices. Understanding breakpoints, fluid grids, and mobile-first approaches.

name: Micro-interactions
description: Designing small, functional animations that provide feedback, guide users, and add personality to interfaces.

name: Visual Consistency
description: Maintaining coherent visual language across screens and states. Ensuring elements look and behave predictably throughout an experience.

name: Problem Solving
description: Analyzing design challenges, exploring multiple solutions, and choosing approaches that best meet user and business needs.

name: Iteration
description: Refining designs through multiple rounds of testing, feedback, and improvement. Knowing when to polish vs. when to pivot.

name: Feedback Integration
description: Receiving, processing, and incorporating feedback from users, stakeholders, and peers while maintaining design integrity.

name: Communication
description: Articulating design decisions and rationale clearly. Presenting work effectively to stakeholders and collaborating with cross-functional teams.

name: Time Management
description: Prioritizing work, meeting deadlines, and balancing quality with speed. Knowing when to continue iterating vs. when to ship.
